scheme_name: Rajya Pratibha Khoj Pariksha Chhatravriti Yojana
brief_description: Under this scheme, students are provided with scholarships or a one-time incentive for pursuing education up to the postgraduate level, after being selected through the State Talent Search Examination organized by the Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, Ajmer.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Rajya Pratibha Khoj Pariksha Chhatravriti Yojana&quot; was implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, students are provided with scholarships or a one-time incentive for pursuing education up to the postgraduate level, after being selected through the State Talent Search Examination organized by the Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, Ajmer. Students studying in Classes 10 and 12 in all government schools, recognized private schools, and Swami Vivekanand Model Schools in the state, who have secured a minimum of 50% marks in Classes 9 and 11 respectively, are eligible to apply for the examination. Students selected through this examination will be entitled to the benefits provided under the scheme.
benefits: Type of Benefit: Scholarship and One-Time Incentive

Class at the time of application | No. of Selected Students & Basis of Selection Basis | Scholarship Rate (For a period of 10 Months) | One-Time Incentive (20 students in each)
Class 10 th | 50 students (≥80% marks) | ₹1,250/month (for Class 11-12) | ₹4,000 for topper, ₹2,000 each for others
Class 12 th - Arts | 50 students (≥80% marks) | ₹2,000/month (for UG & PG) | ₹4,000 for topper, ₹2,000 each for others
Class 12 th - Commerce | 50 students (≥80% marks) | ₹2,000/month (for UG & PG) | ₹4,000 for topper, ₹2,000 each for others
Class 12 th - Science | 50 students (≥80% marks) | ₹2,000/month (for UG & PG) | ₹4,000 for topper, ₹2,000 each for others
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary's bank account. Monthly (for up to 10 months per academic year).
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. The applicant should be a student currently enrolled in Class 10 or Class 12. The student should be studying in a government school, a recognized private school, or a Swami Vivekanand Model School located in Rajasthan. For Class 10 applicants, a minimum of 50% marks should have been secured in Class 9. For Class 12 applicants, at least 50% marks should have been obtained in Class 11. The applicant should have appeared for and qualified in the State Talent Search Examination conducted by the Board of Secondary Education, Rajasthan. To be considered for selection, the applicant should have scored a minimum of 80% marks in the Talent Search Examination.

steps: Step 1: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to contact their respective school or college administration. Step 2: Submit copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required) to the school/college. Step 3: The school will visit the Shala Darpan, Rajasthan Portal. Step 4: Using the school's login credentials (Login ID and Password), the school will fill and submit the application form.

documents_required: Aadhaar Card Copy Jan Aadhaar Card or Bhamashah Card Copy Educational Qualification Marksheet or Certificate Copy Residence proof Any Other Document if Required
